required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial With Quetiapine Prophylaxis Postoperative Delirium in High Risk Surgical Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Controlled, Double-blind, Randomized Clinical Trial for Prophilaxis of Postoperative Delirium in High Risk Surgical Patients With Quetiapine

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación Instituto de Estudios de Ciencias de la Salud de Castilla y León

collaborator.agency: Instituto de Investigación Biomédica de Salamanca

clinical_study.source: Fundación Instituto de Estudios de Ciencias de la Salud de Castilla y León

brief_summary.textblock: Double blinded Clinical trial to test efficacy of Quetiapine versus placebo in reducing postoperative delirium in high risk surgical patients after three days of treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: This study evaluates postoperative delirium in high risk surgical patients to know the incidence of postoperative delirium in patients at risk, over 65 years, treated early with prophylactic quetiapine versus placebo.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due to the crisis SARS-COV-2 pandemic: recruitment of patients for the trial is stopped, healthcare pressure generated, suspend the non-essential scheduled surgical activity and on June 30, 2020 medication expired, funding has been exhausted.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: one arm treatment. one arm placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: To Know the incidence of postoperative delirium in patients at risk, over 65 years, treated early with prophylactic quetiapine versus placebo.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 (± 2) days from the start of treatment in each patient.
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients diagnosed with delirium (number of cases of delirium / total number of patients) within the first four days in both arms. 65 years, treated early with prophylactic quetiapine versus placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days without delirium, if it appears.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days from the start of treatment until delirium.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of delirium, if it appears.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapine.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days with delirium, if it appears. Perceived quality of life. Mortality (all causes).

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of delirium measured with a validated scale. time of appearance the duration and severity. use of another antipsychotics.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of delirium measured with a the Delirium Rating Scale-Revised-98 (DRS-R-98).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Total dose (mg) of other antipsychotic to control symptoms of delirium.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of sedation measured with a validated scale Richmond Agitation-Sedation Scale (RASS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence o absence of extrapyramidal symptoms (tremor, involuntary movements, rigidity).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days from surgery until discharge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of quality of life using Short Form-36 Health Survey questionnaire (SF36).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 ± 2 days from the start (first dose) of treatment with quetiapin.
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality at discharge and at 28 (± 2) days before the start of treatment.

arm_group.description: Quetiapine 25 miligrames 1 hour after surgery and each 12 hours for 3 days
Placebo 1 hour after surgery and each 12 hours for 3 days

intervention.description: Compare the incidence of postoperative delirium.
Compare the incidence of postoperative delirium.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Greater than or equal to 65 years-old patients who will be undergoing major surgery (noncardiac) and having an equal or greater score of 5 on the scale Delphi.
- Age: 70-79 years: 1 point; ≥80 years: 2 points.
- Physical activity: need for assistance, not self-sufficient: 2 point.
- Alcoholism: 1 point.
- Hearing Impaired: 1 point.
- History of delirium: 2 points.
- Emergency surgery: 1 point.
- No laparoscopic surgery: 2 points.
- Admission critical Units: 3 points.
- Value of C-reactive protein (CRP)≥ 10 mg (milligrms) / dL (decilitre): 1 point
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to quetiapine.
- Patients with a score less than 5 on the Delphi scale.
- Diagnosis of delirium at admission.
- Cardiological diseases: qtc ≥ 460 mseg (millisecond) in men, ≥ 470 msec (millisecond) in women, recent MI or cardiac decompensation, 2-3 ° AV block or history of torsades de pointes arrhythmias or ventricular arrhythmias, bradycardia...
- Hypokalemia ≤ 3 mEq / CLK.
- History of drug use.
- Patients on Antipsychotic or antidopaminergic treatment (chlorpromazine, clozapine, olanzapine, risperidone, haloperidol, quetiapine, paliperidone, amisulpride).
- Parkinson's disease.
- Test MINIMENTAL ≤ 24.
- Corps or vascular dementia Levi.
- Hypokinetic movement disorder.
- History of neuroleptic malignant syndrome.
- Central Anticholinergic Syndrome.
- Epilepsy.
- Patients with a wight less than 50 or greater than 200 kg (kilograms).
